alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 24 at 3:21AM PST until February 24 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. * WHERE...Highways 199, 42, Interstate 5 north of Grants Pass to Azalea, and south of Talent. Highway 227 north of Shady Cove, Highway 62 east of Trail, Highway 238 near Jacksonville Hill, and the eastern part of Highway 140. This includes the cities of Ashland, Talent, Butte Falls, Prospect, Selma, Cave Junction, Obrien, Glendale and Azalea. * WHEN...Until 7 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Central Douglas County; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Jackson County
